intro: Streptocaulon calophyllum, commonly known as the yellow bellflower, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes nightshades, and is characterized by its yellow, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has hairy, oval-shaped leaves. Its fruit is a capsule that contains numerous small, smooth seeds. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has been used in traditional medicine for various purposes.
